message: Disgraceful that House Republicans are gutting the ethics office and making Congress less accountable. Where is their leadership and integrity?
On January 9, 1788, Connecticut became the 5th state to join the United States of America.   Happy 229th Birthday Connecticut!
Today I'm joining my House colleagues and education advocates to speak out against President-elect Trump's nomination of Betsy DeVos for Secretary of Education. Watch live here:
Congratulations to Jessica Brocksom of Milford who was sworn in today as Connecticut's 2017 Kid Governor!

This afternoon, Rosa joined her colleague, Congressman Joe Courtney, as well as Lieutenant Governor Nancy Wyman, Dr. Jeffrey Gordon, Michelle Hurteau, Dr. Rebecca Andrews, and Judy Stein to talk about the dangers of repealing the Affordable Care Act. #stopACArepeal

This morning, Rosa was proud to join Reverend Kennedy Hampton, Jr., the congregation of the Shiloh Missionary Baptist Church and the New Haven community for the 47th Annual Love March celebrating the life and legacy of the Reverend Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.
Proudly standing with her colleagues and Connecticut residents who shared their stories to #stopACArepeal! Hundreds gathered to show their support for the Affordable Care Act!

Connecticut is ready for Saturday's Women's March on Washington! 80 full buses are set to leave Connecticut to join thousands more from across the country.    As Rosa's mother, Luisa, said in 1938, "Come on girls, let's make ourselves heard!"

Tonight Rosa joined Mayor Toni Harp, Assistant Police Chief Casanova, New Haven clergy, and immigrant advocates to reaffirm the City's commitment to all of its residents, decrying President Trump's recent Executive Order that seeks to punish "sanctuary cities" by withholding federal grant support.

At a time when we are still fighting a global HIV-AIDS epidemic and are grappling with the devastating effects of Zika, public health organizations are our first line of defense in saving lives. That President Trump has chosen to target them with his first set of executive orders is a turn in the wrong direction that only stands to reverse the progress we have made.  The millions of women and men who marched last weekend, and millions more, are watching. We will not sit silently while President Trump and the far-right promote a dangerous and ideological agenda that will only make life worse for women and their families across the globe. President Trump should reverse this decision immediately and work to strengthen global public health programs, not defund them.

Today Rosa is standing with CT Secretary of State Denise Merrill and representatives of CT's Town Clerks and Registrars of Voters to discuss President Trump's unfounded allegations of wide-spread voter fraud.   Fraud by individual voter is near non-existence. Voting rights are a fundamental cornerstone of our democracy. We should instead be focused on ensuring that electors have the ability to cast their ballot on Election Day.

It is EITC Awareness Day! This afternoon, Rosa was joined by State Senator Martin Looney, State Representative Michael D'Agostino, Deputy Commissioner Joe Mooney, Quinnipiac Professor Michael Marin, and Commissioner Jonathan Harris to talk about the upcoming tax filing season, the tax credits and preparation services available to families, as well as the tax scams that inevitably increase during the filing season.

President Trumpâ€™s decision to turn away refugees, including children fleeing violence in the Middle East, speaks volumes about his character.  When images of children drowning in the Mediterranean Sea or dying in Aleppo flash on our screens, does President Trump not feel their pain? We cannot give into fear and divisive policies when the world needs us to act.  President Trump's actions are completely shameful and we must do all that we can to reverse them immediately.
"Republicans in Congress who remain quiet or tacitly supportive of the ban should recognize that history will remember them as cowards."  Here's some light reading for you, Paul Ryan.

Back in DC and ready to continue fighting Donald J. Trump's hateful anti-refugee, anti-immigrant executive orders! Looking forward to rallying on the steps of the Supreme Court tonight at 6pm. See you there!
Thank you to the thousands of Americans raising your voices with us at the Supreme Court tonight! To Donald J. Trump we say, "No hate, no fear, refugees are welcome here!"

Today I'm joining my Democratic colleagues to call on the Senate to reject Andrew Puzder as President Trump's nominee for Secretary of Labor. American workers deserve better and we cannot allow him to be confirmed. Watch live now!

Are you looking for tax preparation assistance? Make tax season easier with the Volunteer Income Tax Assistance (VITA) program where local volunteer sites are available to help qualifying constituents prepare and file income tax returns.  Help is available through the VITA program to people who generally make $54,000 or less, persons with disabilities and limited English speaking taxpayers who need assistance in preparing their own tax returns.   In addition, the Tax Counseling for the Elderly (TCE) program offers free tax help for all taxpayers, particularly those who are 60 years of age and older, specializing in questions about pensions and retirement-related issues unique to seniors.  Use the VITA / TCE Locator Tool on IRS.gov to find help near you

Let me be very clear, Senate Republicans stole a Supreme Court seat in rejecting Judge Garland. The actions by Majority Leader McConnell and his fellow Republicans were unconscionable, and their failure to follow historic precedent will result in decades of radical far-right decisions from the nationâ€™s highest court. President Trump has already shown that he is willing to bend constitutional powers to their limits and in some cases break them. We must have a strong voice on the Supreme Court who is willing to keep the Presidentâ€™s actions in check and that voice cannot be Justice Gorsuch.  As evidenced by his past rulings and statements on health care, the environment, women's health, immigration, labor, gay rights, and civil rights, Judge Gorsuch threatens to undo years of progress and be a right-wing and regressive voice from the bench. We need a Supreme Court justice who will defend the inalienable rights of all Americans, not just the privileged few. Over the course of his career, Judge Gorsuch has been an activist judge and I strongly urge my colleagues in the Senate to vote against his confirmation and stop both Judge Gorsuch and President Trump from pushing a conservative agenda on the Supreme Court.

A vote for Betsy DeVos is a vote to hollow out public education. The Senate must vote 'NO' to reject her nomination and ensure that we increase our commitment to Americaâ€™s public schools, not diminish it.

Earlier this week I introduced a resolution in the House of Representatives calling for an end to domestic child sex trafficking. Each year, the Super Bowl becomes a magnet for child sex trafficking, with women and girls across the country being sold for sex and exploited during the event.  However, child sex trafficking does not just take place once a year during the Super Bowl. Congress and law enforcement officials should continue to raise this issue throughout the year, when thousands of victims are trafficked on a daily basis without the mediaâ€™s spotlight. Together, we can advance smart policies and solutions to end these horrific crimes against Americaâ€™s young girls once and for all.
Proud to join our community to to say it loud and say it clear, Refugees Are Welcome Here!
Thank you to Senate Democrats for standing up for America's students! Let's say it loud and clear: #NoOnDeVos!

Ms. DeVos, welcome to your new job. Your words and your actions matter, not just for the Department of Education, but for the millions of students and teachers that now depend on you.  When you come before my Appropriations subcommittee, we will have an honest conversation on the many programs within the Department of Education, including those for students with disabilities, children in high-poverty schools, and victims of sexual assault on college campuses.  The Department of Education must give our children the opportunity to thrive and we will not let the Trump Administration diminish its work.

Unreal that Senate Republicans just silenced Senator Warren for reading a letter from Coretta Scott King. We are better than this. Jeff Sessions should not be confirmed as Attorney General and the American people deserve to know why. #RejectSessions
Great news! We're going to continue fighting for American values, which will always triumph over hate and fear.
Heartfelt congratulations to the UCONN Women's basketball team on their í ½í²¯th consecutive win! Terrific game! #HuskyPride #BleedBlue #simplythebest

Mr. Flynnâ€™s resignation confirms what we have long suspected, that the Trump Administration engaged in illegal contact with the Russians. Mr. Flynnâ€™s resignation raises a number of questions, including why President Trump chose to keep him on staff for weeks after learning the truth. The American people deserve the answers to these questions and we demand it.

Andrew Puzder has a history of anti-worker policies, which include fighting against paying workers their hard earned overtime, opposing expansion of the Affordable Care Act, and engaging in marketing tactics that degrade women. His decision to withdraw is a victory for American workers everywhere.  President Trump repeatedly assured the American people that he would fight for the working men and women in this country. He now has the opportunity to choose a Secretary of Labor who will side with the American worker, not corporate interests.
Today I'm joining my House colleagues to demand a renegotiated NAFTA that works for the American worker. Watch live now.

This afternoon, Rosa is speaking with a group of constituents who are concerned about the repeal of the Affordable Care Act. Each of them have a different story, but the common thread among them all is that each suffer from a pre-existing condition and are afraid that they will not be able to access affordable health care without the protections included in the ACA.    Accessing health insurance of any kind was out of reach for these constituents prior to the passage of the ACA.  These are the real faces of the ACA.  #savetheACA

At Hartford Prints! this morning to join owner Rory Gale and the CT Campaign For Paid Family and Medical Leave this morning with Senator Chris Dodd along with several business owners and advocates to talk about the need for Paid Family and Medical Leave.   The CT legislature is considering legislation to provide paid family and medical leave, joining other states like California, New Jersey, and Rhode Island who have already successfully implemented similar policies.    Rosa is the author of the FAMILY Act which would provide a similar benefit at the federal level.   "It is time for our public policies to catch up with the economic realities of working families."

Many thanks to the JSA Chapter at Amity for inviting Rosa to come and speak with them this afternoon! Great questions and fantastic enthusiasm! Good luck at the Mock Congress in Washington later this week!!

This morning, Rosa joined her colleague, Senator Chris Murphy, at B'nai Jacob in Woodbridge to meet with leaders of the Jewish community regarding the recent bomb threat against the Jewish Community Center as well as the increase of anti-Semitic incidents throughout local communities.   "This kind of hatred and intolerance cannot be ignored. Who are we if we do not speak out?"

This morning, Rosa is at with CT State Medical Society, joined by immediate past president Dr. Henry Jacobs and Dr. Jacob Hacker, Director of the Institution for Social and Policy Studies at Yale University, to talk about the economic impacts of repealing the Affordable Care Act.   Did you know that in repealing the ACA will give the 400 highest income families in the US an average tax cut of $7 million a year and nearly will give health insurance companies and drug manufacturers nearly $250 billion in tax cuts over the next 10 years?   #SaveTheACA

Rosa spent the afternoon at Wesleyan with  Mayor Dan Drew's Group Psychology in Politics: Local, State, and National Perspectives class.   Rosa presented a case-study of the TransPacific Partnership and the issues around its eventual defeat. Great conversation with a really engaged group of students!

This morning, Rosa was a member of the Women in Government panel at the Yale Women's Leadership Initiative's Women Empowering Women (W.E. Women) Conference.  She was joined by State Representatives Pat Dillon and Cristin Vahey.    Engaging conversation about women running and serving in elected office with a great group of young women!   "There are barriers, less today than in the past, but you can't let that stop you. Never be afraid to stand and to stand up for what you believe in!"

This morning, Rosa has been joined by Hamden Police Chief Tom Wydra and community activists to discuss the "Hearing Protection Act" which would remove silencers from the National Firearms Act, repealing the purchase tax that was imposed over 80 years ago and making it easier for people to access and purchase firearm silencers.  Law enforcement officials and gun control advocates alike have serious concerns about the increased accessibility of firearm silencers.
Town Hall: Please join Rosa this Monday, March 6th, at 5:30pm at Hamden Middle School

Attorney General Sessions must resign. As more revelations regarding the Trump campaignâ€™s collusion with the Russians continue to come to light, the President and his Administration have a responsibility to call for a special investigation and give the American people the full story.  Attorney General Sessions has shown that he is both not impartial on the matter and that he is willing to lie under oath in order to cover up his actions. Recusing himself from the investigation into Russiaâ€™s meddling in our election is not enough, and he must step down immediately.

Stopping people from Muslim majority countries from obtaining visas and shutting down our nationâ€™s refugee program were the goals of the first executive order and they are now the goals of the second executive order. Even Stephen Miller, the Senior White House Policy Advisor has said that the new executive order would â€˜have the same basic policy outcomeâ€™ as the first.  The new executive order on refugees and immigrants continues the same policies that will not make us safer, despite the Administrationâ€™s claims that the travel ban is about national security. The Presidentâ€™s decision to sign this executive order into law does not make it easier to fight terrorism, and instead only endangers American lives by emboldening ISIS and making the U.S. a target.  No matter how the President rewrites it, this redo of his executive order on refugees and immigrants is still religious discrimination and is just as shameful as the first one. As the American Civil Liberties Union points out, the new executive order is still unconstitutional. We cannot allow this un-American order to be upheld and American values must always win out over hate and fear.
Many thanks to the more than 200 folks who came to tonight's Town Hall meeting in Hamden. Great conversation!

Rosa is joined this afternoon by (from L-R) Breast Surgeon Dr. Kristen Zarfos, New Haven Legal Assistance attorney Sheldon Toubman, Planned Parenthood of Southern New England President and CEO Judy Tabar, and Fair Haven Community Health Center Executive Director  Dr. Suzanne Lagarde to discuss the impacts of the repeal of the Affordable Care Act on women's health.   If the ACA is repealed and the Republican replacement plan succeeds, it jeopardizes access to affordable health care for millions of Americans, particularly women, because it would eliminate federal funding for Planned Parenthood and makes significant cuts to Medicaid funding.

Not only will 14 million hardworking Americans lose health insurance starting next year, 24 million will lose health insurance over the next ten years. The GOP bill will also send health care premiums sky high over the next two years by â€˜inducing fewer comparatively healthy people to sign up.â€™   None of this news should come as a surprise. The GOP replacement plan will give huge tax cuts to the very wealthy, paid for with higher priced insurance for older Americans and working Americans.  Republicans must ask themselves how far they are willing to go to tow the party line. Eliminating health care for 24 million Americans should be too high of a price and Republicans should get rid of this bill immediately.

The Republican health care plan will throw millions of Americans off insurance, raise deductibles, shift the cost of health care to the states, and raise insecurity. Not only will #TrumpCare result in working and older Americans paying significantly more for health care, millionaires and billionaires will get massive tax breaks. The Republican health care plan is the wrong path forward and Congress must reject it.

Speaker Ryan and Republicans have now postponed a vote to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act. Why? Well for starters, the Republican plan forces families to pay higher premiums and deductibles while kicking more than 24 million Americans off their health insurance. The plan also steals from Medicare and forces older Americans to pay higher premiums through a crushing age tax.  The Republican plan is a disaster, and it hurts hardworking American families while giving the richest Americans a major tax break. Speaker Ryan, letâ€™s work together to fix the Affordable Care Act, not take away lifesaving care for millions of Americans. We must defeat the Republican plan to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act.

The Republican health care proposal will kick 24 million Americans off their health care plans and raise premiums and deductibles, all while giving the wealthiest Americans a major tax cut. We have an obligation to the people of this country to vote â€˜noâ€™ on this misrepresented bill. Speaker Paul Ryan, ditch the bill!

Great news! You can't try to kick 24 million Americans off their health insurance, raise premiums and deductibles, enact an age tax on older Americans, and raid Medicare without a fight. The Republican health care bill was a disaster and I'm glad to see it pulled.
Best of luck to the CT women's basketball teams in their Sweet 16 matchups today! You make us proud!! (catch both games on ESPN, UCONN at 1:30p and Quinnipiac at 4pm)
NA

Always proud to join the New Haven Fire and Police Departments for the annual Chief's Cup! Congratulations to Police Officer of the Year, Detective Michael Wuchek, and New Haven Firefighter of the Year, Deputy Chief Thomas!   Many thanks to all of our police and firefighters and their families for their unparalleled service to our community.
Congratulations to the UCONN Lady Huskies who are on to the Elite 8!! #huskypride
Though the season has come to an end, the Quinnipiac women's basketball team has much to be proud of! Great job!

Powerful conversation with several local residents who participate in TEAM's energy assistance program.  Amanda, Ebony, and Wendy are working parents; Roger and Crissan have both suffered a disability after working for many years; and Estelle is a retired senior whose sole income is Social Security.  As was said more than once today, this is about a hand-up, not a hand-out.   President Trump's proposed budget would eliminate the Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program as well as the Weatherization Program.
Well done Huskies!!! On to the Final Four! #huskypride

President Trump's budget will cause real harm to millions of Americans and it's clear that Secretary Price can't defend the Administration's outrageous cuts. Americans deserve better than what the President is proposing and Congress must reject this budget.

In Milford this afternoon to talk about the importance of the Community Development Block Grant program to municipalities like Milford.    The CDBG program provides funding directly to states and municipalities and allows  them the discretion to determine how that funding will best benefit their communities.   In Milford, CDBG funds have been utilized to fund the City's single family home repair program as well as support capital improvement projects for local non-profit organizations.   The CDBG program is slated for elimination in the President's initial budget proposal.

111 game winning streak and, more importantly, awe-inspiring dedication, hard work, and team spirit. We may not be going to the championship game, but you make us proud! #uconnwomensbasketball #huskypride
Please join Congresswoman Rosa DeLauro for a discussion on how to support workers, keep good paying jobs here and create good paying jobs that grow our community

Equal Pay Day falls 94 days into 2017, which is 94 days too late for millions of American women and their families. Every year, I hope we never have to recognize this day, and though we have made some progress in closing the wage gap, it still exists for far too many.  Women and men in the same job should have the same pay, and today my colleagues and I are reintroducing the Paycheck Fairness Act, a strong step forward in ensuring that we close the wage gap once and for all. This legislation addresses the issue in a comprehensive and sensible manner, and it is long overdue. Let's end the wage gap once and for all!

The chemical attack earlier this week on innocent Syrians, including children and babies, has demanded the worldâ€™s attention and the U.S. airstrikes are a measured and proportional response to these despicable acts. The Assad regime has created a humanitarian crisis in Syria, killing scores of its own people using conventional weapons, and committing war crimes in violation of international law using chemical weapons. More than 450,000 Syrians have been killed in the nationâ€™s civil war and millions more have been displaced as a result of Assadâ€™s atrocities.  President Trump must work with Congress to develop a clear strategy on Syria, and Congress has the Constitutional responsibility to debate the use of military force. Congress should immediately return to session and discuss this critical matter. With millions of lives on the line, the U.S. must work with our international partners and allies to bring Assad to justice. President Trump should also rescind his ban on refugees fleeing the Assad regime. When a humanitarian crisis sends millions of people fleeing their homes, we must step up and respond with the American values that have guided our nation for generations.

Many thanks to LifeBridge Community Services for allowing Rosa to ride-along this morning with Johanna, one of their drivers, and see the Meals on Wheels program in action.  Johanna's route took them through East Haven, North Branford, Branford, and New Haven.  While on the ride-along, Rosa also had the opportunity to hear directly from clients why the Meals on Wheels program is important to them.

This afternoon, Rosa visited the CT Mission of Mercy (CTMOM) Free Dental Clinic where hundreds of Connecticut residents were receiving the dental care they needed.  Many thanks to all of the dentists and volunteers who make this annual event possible. #CTMOM   Doors will open again tomorrow at 6am. More info is below.  CTMOM New Haven 2017 Friday, April 7th - Saturday, April 8th  Floyd Little Athletic Center 480 Sherman Parkway New Haven, CT 06511  Clinic Doors Open at 6am First-Come; First-Served

Rosa is with Senator Murphy this morning with  social service organizations and advocates from New Haven and around the state to hear about the impact the President's proposed budget will have on their clients.  Did you know that the amount annual amount spent to feed one senior on the Meals on Wheels program is the equivalent of one day in the hospital or one week in a nursing home?     To say that these programs are not providing effective results is simply unconscionable.
To all of those families celebrating on this first night of Passover, Chag Sameach
Wishing you and your families a wonderful Easter Holiday. Buona Pasqua!

This morning Rosa visited the Sound School in New Haven where she was joined by advocates and students to discuss the negative impact of the President's proposal to eliminate funding for all geographic programs within the EPA, including the Long Island Sound.  "Millions have been invested in cleaning and protecting the Long Island Sound as well as other estuaries across the country. To abandon those efforts is unconscionable."   Special thanks to Sound School Principal Rebecca Gratz for hosting this morning's press conference and the the students of Sound School and Wintergreen for the wonderful welcome message!   Many thanks to Curt Johnson from Save the Sound, Louis Burch from Citizen's Campaign for the Environment,  Stewart Hudson from Audubon Connecticut, and Dr. Rebecca French of the Connecticut Institute for Resilience and Climate Adaption at UCONN for lending their voices to this important issue.

Exciting news! The Democratic Womenâ€™s Working Group now has a Facebook page! Like our page to get important updates about the work weâ€™re doing to advance women and girls, and to fight back against Republican attempts to roll back the progress weâ€™ve made.

It's a beautiful opening day for the Foxon Recreation League - celebrating their 60th season!! Let's Play Ball!!

Rosa just stopped by the prescription drug take-back location at the Branford Police Department, one of about 70 locations across the state where old prescriptions are being collected for disposal.   Unused or expired prescription medications are a public safety issue, potentially leading to accidental overdose, abuse, or the contamination of the water supply.  The Branford PD hosts such events twice a year and on average collect some 200 pounds of unused or expired medications.
In solidarity with Local 33
NA

If the Republican health care bill passes today, the American people should be in the street to call out the immorality of this legislation. They should decry this offense against humanity and this offense against the American people. To the American peopleâ€”do not let them get away with it!

The fight continues! Many thanks to Action Together Connecticut - New Haven County for calling the community together to once again reiterate support for the Affordable Care Act.   "The bill passed by the House yesterday is an offense against humanity and the American people. We cannot let them get away with it!"

So honored tonight to join Betsy Nilan, Mary Nilan, and the many friends and supporters who gathered tonight to celebrate the Grand Opening of the Get In Touch Foundation's new office in Milford and to take a moment to remember the organization's founder, and Betsy and Mary's mother, Mary Ann Wasil.   It was a particular poignant to celebrate Mary Ann tonight as I remember the day that she enrolled in a health insurance plan made possible through the Affordable Care Act. Mary Ann was battling a third round of breast cancer. The care that she was able to receive through the affordable health insurance plan she enrolled in allowed her several more years with her three children and to continue her work with the Get In Touch Foundation, the organization that was so dear to her heart.  #GIT #breastcancerawareness

There is no better way to start a Saturday than to celebrate with some of the 1st grade students who participated in this year's Rosa's Readers program!  They are wonderful!   Special congratulations to our Big Reader, Romeo Thompson of Booth Hill Elementary School in Shelton, who read a whopping 150 books during the 3 month program; and to Aydan Davis of Clintonville Elementary School in North Haven who won our bookmark contest!   I also want to recognize John Lyman Elementary School in Middlefield who had 100% participation and whose 1st grade students read an astounding 1156 books!
Wonderful time at the Friend's Center for Children's Fair Haven Stroll!

This afternoon, Rosa announced the winners of the 3rd Congressional District's annual Congressional Arts Competition. The winning piece will be displayed with others from across the country for the next year in the US Capitol. The second and third place will hang in Rosa's DC and District offices respectively over the same time.  Congratulations to this year's winner, Catherine Valloso from East Haven, a senior at Sacred Heart, for her color pencil piece entitled "Self Portrait!"   Second place was awarded to Ashley Feliconio of Hamden, a junior at Sacred Heart, for her water color piece entitled "Untitled" and third place went to Kim Ly from North Haven, a junior at North Haven High School, for her charcoal and graphite piece "Anatomy of a Sculpture Icon: Guardian Lion."
This afternoon, Rosa joined Day for a Vet at VFW Post 7788, serving lunch and taking the opportunity to thank the community's veterans for their service to our nation.

Please join Rosa on Wednesday evening in Milford for a Town Hall discussion.  Rosa will welcome Brandon DeBot from the Center for Budget and Policy Priorities as well as local economist, Dr. Ed Deak, who will talk about the potential impact of proposed tax policy reforms.

This morning, Rosa was at Rushford in Middletown to talk about the on-going efforts to combat the opioid crisis. Connecticut recently received a $5.5 million dollar SAMHSA grant to expand its efforts to address the epidemic in the state.    Rosa was joined by officials currently working on the front lines of the epidemic, including representatives from Rushford, the Connecticut Department of Mental Health and Addiction Services, Middlesex Hospital, Mayor Dan Drew and the Middletown Police and Fire Departments.

Reminder: On Wednesday, May 10 at 6:00 PM, I'm holding a town hall at Jonathan Law High School in Milford. We'll have a wide-ranging discussion on President Trump, his tax plan, and more. Here are the details and I hope to see you Wednesday night!  When: Wednesday, May 10, 2017 at 6:00 PM (Doors open at 5:30) Where: Jonathan Law High School, 20 Lansdale Avenue, Milford, Connecticut

Letâ€™s be clear about what just happened: the President of the United States fired the person leading the investigation into the President of the United States.  The sudden firing of FBI Director James Comey deserves an urgent and thorough explanation by the White House, given the ongoing and active criminal investigation into the Trump campaignâ€™s relations with the Russian government during the 2016 election.  These events further underscore why I have continued to demand an independent commission with subpoena power in order to get to the bottom of the Russia investigation.

At the Women's Business Development Center's (WBDC) new office in Derby to sit down with some local women small business owners and non-profit leaders to hear about the issues of concern to them as well as how the WBDC has helped them to build their businesses.

Many thanks to all of those who came out for tonight's Town Hall and to our special guests, Connecticut economist Dr. Ed Deak and Tax Policy Fellow Brandon DeBot from the Center for Budget and Policy Priorities for joining me and helping to clarify some of the implications of the Administration's proposed tax reform policies.
Your voices need to be heard loud and clear. You cannot get tired, you cannot give up hope. You just have to keep at it.

The time for infrastructure investment is now! Thanks to my colleague Congresswoman Elizabeth Esty, Don Shubert of the Connecticut Construction Industries Association, Jim Doheny of the New Haven Building Trades, and Susan Rapini of the Greater New Haven Chamber of Commerce for joining Rosa today.

Luis Barrios deserves to remain in the U.S. permanently and I am overwhelmed with joy that he has been granted a two year stay. Luisâ€™s family, the Derby community, and the many advocacy groups working on his behalf have helped shine a light on this case and made todayâ€™s announcement possible. While we have achieved a great milestone in Luisâ€™s immigration case, there is still much more work to do.  The U.S. Department of Justice should reopen this case immediately and give Luis the opportunity to present his case for asylum. We also must continue to fight the Trump Administrationâ€™s immoral actions on immigration and Congress should immediately pass comprehensive immigration reform to end the cruel practice of breaking up families.
My mother remains my greatest inspiration... Happy Mother's Day to all celebrating this special day!

It's National Infrastructure Week!    In March of 2012,  Rosa was joined by labor and construction industry leaders in front of the Moses Wheeler Bridge to talk about the economic impact of investment in transportation infrastructure in Connecticut.  Infrastructure investment creates good-paying, local jobs while also improving the local business climate and quality of life for residents.  #timetobuild

This afternoon, Rosa had the opportunity to sit down with a variety of advocates to talk about the continued need for the Violence Against Women Act and federal investment in combatting domestic violence and sexual assault.  Many thanks to BHcare for hosting today's roundtable as well as the Connecticut Coalition Against Domestic Violence and the Connecticut Alliance to End Sexual Assault for helping to pull everyone together today.

It's National Infrastructure Week!  It's not only about roads and bridges, but also water, electricity, and telecommunications.   Here in 2013, Rosa was in Prospect where she had helped the Town secure funding to help install a 2200 foot 12 inch pipe to bring city water to the new school facility that was being constructed.  #timetobuild

News that President Trump has leaked highly-classified intelligence, reportedly provided by Israel, to one of our adversaries not only compromises our current intelligence, it may compromise our ability to collect intelligence from our sources in the future.  Whether intentional or unintentional, the President has undermined our ability to collaborate with allies around the world through the dangerous times we live in.  When the security of the United States and the safety of people around the world are at stake, the President must take this information, and his office, seriously. This continuing Russian connection makes us less secure and less safe.

It's National Infrastructure Week!   Investments in our infrastructure have economic ripple effects throughout the supply chain, supporting a variety of small businesses in our community, like A.H. Harris & Sons in New Haven, a construction supply company that celebrated it's 100th anniversary last year.  A.H. Harris serves the heavy and highway, commercial, industrial and residential markets specializing in areas of concrete formwork and accessories, concrete repair and restoration, geotextiles and erosion control.  #TimeToBuild

From day one, the Trump Administration has been mired in scandal. The appointment of Robert Mueller as Special Counsel to oversee the investigation into Russiaâ€™s efforts to influence the 2016 U.S. election is a critical step in a long process. Director Mueller has a long history of distinguished service and integrity.   We still need an independent commission to investigate Russiaâ€™s involvement in our electoral processes, to educate the American public on this assault on our democracy, and to work to develop ways to protect our country in the future.

Today, the Trump Administration sent notice to Congress that it will seek to renegotiate NAFTA. As the process to renegotiate the trade agreement moves forward, House Democrats will focus on both the content of the new agreement and who is involved in the negotiations.

It's National Infrastructure Week!  The economic development benefits that can be leveraged through infrastructure investment are critical for our cities and towns.  For example, the TIGER grants that have helped to support New Haven's Downtown Crossing project (groundbreaking and mid-construction pics below) have attracted millions of additional private dollars, creating hundreds of temporary and long-term jobs and bringing new businesses to New Haven, all while reconnecting the City's Downtown and Hill neighborhoods.  #TimeToBuild
The drip, drip, drip of details on President Trump and Russia continues. We need an independent commission to investigate Russiaâ€™s involvement in the 2016 election now more than ever.

The Trump Administration is proposing an outrageous $193 billion cut to SNAP, a program that feeds people in the U.S. This is a cruel and heartless turning of our backs on the people in this nation who are hungry and we can do better.

It's a full house at Bella Vista this morning where Rosa is joining Senator Chris Murphy along with Judy Stein, Executive Director of the Center for Medicare Advocacy and Ellen Andrews, Executive Director of the CT Health Policy Project to talk with folks about the impacts of the repeal of the Affordable Care Act on seniors and the disabled, particularly those who are dependent on Medicaid.

President Trumpâ€™s disastrous decision to pull the U.S. out of the Paris Agreement will roll back years of progress in our fight against climate change. More than 190 countries all agree that climate change is real and it is extraordinarily disappointing that President Trump is choosing to sit on the sidelines when the world needs us to act.  With this decision, President Trump and his climate-denying advisors continue their assault on science and the environment. I strongly urge the Trump Administration to reconsider this decision and make the right choice for our children and grandchildren. We have a remarkable opportunity to address one of the most serious man-made issues of our time and protect our planetâ€™s future, but we must act now.
Cutting SNAP by $193 billion & turning our backs on the nation's hungry is shameful. America can and must do better.

My heart is with everyone at this morningâ€™s Congressional baseball practice, including Congressman Scalise, the staff, Capitol Police, and others. This morning, Rosa is in New Haven, joined by advocates and education leaders, to talk about the impacts of the Trump Administrationâ€™s proposed cuts to Medicaid for children with disabilities and their families. The impacts of these cuts would be felt across a childâ€™s entire care spectrum, from school to medical care. As a result of the proposed cuts, the costs of care would be transferred to states, institutions, or families, none of which will be able to close the financial gaps such cuts will leave.  Schools across the country rely on Medicaid to provide services to millions of students with disabilities in the U.S. For more than three decades, this social safety net program has helped schools meet student needâ€”covering some of the cost of special education services, including physical therapists and equipment.

Now that the Senate Republican health care bill is public, it is clearer than ever why Majority Leader McConnell and Senate Republicans hid it for weeks. Not only will the bill ration health care for millions of Americans, it is a massive giveaway to the wealthy at the expense of our kids. Millions of American lives depend on it.

This afternoon, Rosa visited the Willows in Woodbridge where she spoke with a group of residents about the proposed cuts to Medicaid in the President's budget and the legislation proposed to repeal/replace the Affordable Care Act.   More than half of the residents at the Willows depend on Medicaid for their long term care coverage. Rosa heard from the group how they and their families would be impacted if proposed cuts were to go into effect. Many are unsure what will happen to them if their Medicaid coverage is significantly reduced or eliminated all-together.
Many thanks to the all of those who came out to speak to Rosa this morning at Neighborhood Office Hours.

At the New Haven Health Department this morning to announce the introduction of the SMART Child Act, which stands for Screen, Manage, Address, and Remove Toxins for Children Act. This bill reauthorizes the Public Health Service Act to increase funding for lead testing and treatment.  There are no safe lead blood levels and  children are particularly vulnerable to the effects of lead poisoning which can include developmental delays and brain damage.

Joining Senators Blumenthal and Murphy earlier this afternoon, Rosa met with Nury Chavarria who recently received a deportation order after living and working in the United States for nearly 25 years. A mother of 4, Nury is now trying to stay with her children. We stand with her.

Honored to join the Connecticut Fund for the Environment and the many advocates who came out today to welcome Long Island Sound's new Soundkeeper, Bill Lucey, and to pay special tribute to the late Terry Backer, the first Soundkeeper, with the christening of a vessel in his honor.   Merchant marine, lobsterman, state representative, advocate, mentor, and friend - - Terry's passion for protecting and preserving the Long Island Sound was without equal.  The vessel bearing his name, which will be used by the new Soundkeeper, is a fitting tribute to his invaluable contributions to the Sound and our community.

This morning it was my honor to present Jacob Greenberg with the service medals he earned during his service in the Army during World War II in the Pacific Theater.  He will celebrate his 99th birthday on Sunday!   Mr. Greenberg joined the Army Air Forces in January of 1942 and served with the 5th Air Force 91st Photographic Wing, earning the rank of Corporal before his honorable discharge in 1946.  The 91st Photographic Wing was the primary source of aerial photography and mapping for the 5th Air Force in the Southwest Pacific Theater.

I am excited to have Sheryl Sandberg's support in the fight to pass the FAMILY Act. The time for paid family and medical leave is long overdueâ€”and we will keep fighting until no American worker has to choose between sacrificing a paycheck and caring for their family during the toughest times.

While it is great that President Trump has finally come around to recognizing the opioid epidemic for what it isâ€”a national emergencyâ€”we need much more than talk to solve the problem. Now is the time for action.  With 91 Americans dying each day from opioid overdoses, Congress must immediately pass the Public Health Emergency Fund Act to put $5 billion into the existing Public Health Emergency Fund.

Today, I visited NUMET Industries, a defense manufacturing facility in Orange, to highlight the importance of worker training and apprenticeship programs. As we celebrate #WomensEqualityDay, we must remain committed to the work ahead.
